text: Kiefer Sutherland arrested and accused of assaulting ride-share driver, L.A. police say - NBC News
fullText: Actor Kiefer Sutherland, a film and television star since the 1980s, was arrested Monday after he was alleged to have physically assaulted and threatened a ride-share driver, police said.

text: Trump administration indefinitely pauses immigrant visa processing for 75 nations - The Washington Post
fullText: Authorities said the pause on processing immigrant visas aims to crack down on immigrants the Trump administration believes are likely to become reliant on public benefits.

text: Candidates have legal standing to challenge election laws, the Supreme Court rules - NPR
fullText: In a case related to Illinois state law about the return of mail ballots, the U.S. Supreme Court says political candidates have the legal standing to challenge election policies.

text: Source: LHP Suarez, BoSox agree to 5-year deal - ESPN
fullText: The Boston Red Sox have agreed to a five-year, $130 million deal with left-hander Ranger Suarez, a source told ESPN, confirming multiple reports.

text: Widespread Verizon outage prompts emergency alerts in Washington, New York City - NBC News

text: Patches of low vaccination in the US are becoming bigger, riskier holes - CNN
fullText: Opting out of childhood vaccines is becoming more common across most of the United States, leaving larger shares of the population vulnerable to preventable diseases like measles, which is continuing its record-breaking spread across the country.

text: Grammy-nominated musician John Forté found dead at 50 in Massachusetts home - NBC News
fullText: NEW YORK — John Forté, the Grammy-nominated musician known for his work with the Fugees and the Refugee Camp All-Stars among others, has died at age 50.
